segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s making me really nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn’t even seem to notice, and that’s terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to get so slippery that someone is going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is already in danger, and now the water is making everything worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman is, just standing there in the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a disaster unfold in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so focused on the cookies that she doesn’t see the water either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the faucet before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand here and watch this happen; it’s too stressful.
segments.speaker: PAR
